segments.text: I see the boy standing on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar, and it's making me really nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he's going to fall and hurt himself if he's not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it's about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the girl standing nearby, waiting for a cookie, and it's making me a bit angry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She should know better than to encourage him to do something so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of what's happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really focused on her task to not notice the boy on the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water overflowing from the sink, and it's creating a real mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone notices it soon before it causes any damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the garden outside the window, and it looks so calm and tidy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a contrast to the chaos unfolding in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will turn around soon and see what's going on.
segments.speaker: PAR
